### 7.4 Client Component Requirements

- Must include `'use client'` directive
- Can use React hooks and event handlers
- Must handle client-side state management
- Should implement proper error boundaries

### 7.5 Accessibility Requirements

- Must be keyboard navigable
- Must provide appropriate ARIA labels and roles
- Must support screen readers
- Must meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards

### 7.6 Performance Requirements

- Must minimize re-renders
- Should implement proper memoization where appropriate
- Must handle loading and error states gracefully
- Should support lazy loading if applicable

## 9. AddHealthRecordModal Component Requirements

### 9.1 Props Requirements

#### isOpen Prop
- **Type**: `boolean`
- **Required**: Yes

#### onClose Prop
- **Type**: `() => void`
- **Required**: Yes

#### onSuccess Prop
- **Type**: `() => void`
- **Required**: Yes

### 9.3 Behavioral Requirements (from Tests)

#### Test Suite: AddHealthRecordModal.test.tsx

**Test Cases**:
- renders modal when isOpen is true with proper ARIA attributes
- does not render when isOpen is false
- displays correct title from translations
- renders close button with proper aria-label and SVG icon
- renders modal backdrop with correct styling and click handler
- renders modal content area with correct styling
- renders HealthRecordForm with correct props
- moves focus to close button when modal opens using fake timers
- stores and restores focus to previously focused element when modal closes
- handles focus restoration when lastFocusedElement is null

- handles Shift+Tab navigation in reverse direction
- handles focus management when no focusable elements exist

- only handles Escape key when modal is open
- prevents Tab from leaving modal (focus trap)
- respects tabindex attributes in navigation
- closes modal when clicking backdrop
- does not close modal when clicking modal content
- calls onClose when close button is clicked
- prevents body scrolling when modal is open
- restores body scroll when modal closes
- passes correct props to HealthRecordForm
- calls both onSuccess and onClose when form succeeds
- calls onSuccess before onClose in correct sequence
- maintains modal state during form submission
- has proper ARIA attributes
- properly associates modal title with aria-labelledby
- has descriptive aria-label for close button
- ensures modal content is accessible to screen readers
- follows logical tab order for keyboard navigation
- adds keydown event listener when modal opens
- removes keydown event listener when modal closes
- cleans up event listeners on component unmount
- handles multiple open/close cycles without duplicate listeners
- cleans up even if component unmounts while modal is open
- handles undefined onClose gracefully
- handles undefined onSuccess gracefully
- handles focus management when close button ref is null
- handles keyboard navigation when no focusable elements exist
- handles rapid open/close state changes
- renders with correct CSS classes for backdrop
- renders modal content with proper styling
- ensures modal has proper z-index for layering
- has responsive margins and max-width
- handles overflow with max-height constraint

- Should implement proper memoization where appropriate
- Must handle loading and error states gracefully
- Should support lazy loading if applicable

---

## 10. BehaviorAnalyticsDashboard Component Requirements

### 10.1 Props Requirements

#### timeRange Prop
- **Type**: `"7d" | "30d" | "90d" | "1y"`
- **Required**: No

#### behaviorTypes Prop
- **Type**: `string[]`
- **Required**: No

#### refreshInterval Prop
- **Type**: `number`
- **Required**: No

#### showRealTimeUpdates Prop
- **Type**: `boolean`
- **Required**: No

### 10.4 Client Component Requirements

- Must include `'use client'` directive
- Can use React hooks and event handlers
- Must handle client-side state management
- Should implement proper error boundaries

### 10.5 Accessibility Requirements

- Must be keyboard navigable
- Must provide appropriate ARIA labels and roles
- Must support screen readers
- Must meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards

### 10.6 Performance Requirements

- Must minimize re-renders
- Should implement proper memoization where appropriate
- Must handle loading and error states gracefully
- Should support lazy loading if applicable

- **Required**: No

## Implementation Guidelines

### Component Development Standards
1. **Type Safety**: All components must be fully typed with TypeScript
2. **Error Boundaries**: Components should implement appropriate error boundaries
3. **Performance**: Components must meet performance requirements
4. **Accessibility**: All accessibility requirements must be met
5. **Testing**: Comprehensive test coverage is required
6. **Documentation**: Components must be properly documented

### Quality Assurance
1. **Code Review**: All component changes must undergo code review
2. **Testing**: All tests must pass before deployment
3. **Accessibility Audit**: Regular accessibility audits must be conducted
4. **Performance Monitoring**: Component performance must be monitored
5. **User Testing**: Components should undergo user testing when appropriate

This document serves as the definitive specification for component behavior requirements, extracted from comprehensive analysis of tests, stories, and TypeScript interfaces.
